  678 |     |     // ======== Filesystem ========
  679 |     | 
  680 |     |     /// Closes file for reading, resetting the offset and allowing to read it from beginning with readLine.
  681 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  682 |     |     function closeFile(string calldata path) external;
  683 |     | 
  684 |     |     /// Copies the contents of one file to another. This function will **overwrite** the contents of `to`.
  685 |     |     /// On success, the total number of bytes copied is returned and it is equal to the length of the `to` file as reported by `metadata`.
  686 |     |     /// Both `from` and `to` are relative to the project root.
  687 |     |     function copyFile(string calldata from, string calldata to) external returns (uint64 copied);
  688 |     | 
  689 |     |     /// Creates a new, empty directory at the provided path.
  690 |     |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  691 |     |     /// - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
  692 |     |     /// - A parent of the given path doesn't exist and `recursive` is false.
  693 |     |     /// - `path` already exists and `recursive` is false.
  694 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  695 |     |     function createDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
  696 |     | 
  697 |     |     /// Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  698 |     |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  699 |     |     function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath) external returns (address deployedAddress);
  700 |     | 
  701 |     |     /// Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  702 |     |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  703 |     |     /// Additionally accepts abi-encoded constructor arguments.
  704 |     |     function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath, bytes calldata constructorArgs)
  705 |     |         external
  706 |     |         returns (address deployedAddress);
  707 |     | 
  708 |     |     /// Returns true if the given path points to an existing entity, else returns false.
  709 |     |     function exists(string calldata path) external view returns (bool result);
  710 |     | 
  711 |     |     /// Performs a foreign function call via the terminal.
  712 |     |     function ffi(string[] calldata commandInput) external returns (bytes memory result);
  713 |     | 
  714 |     |     /// Given a path, query the file system to get information about a file, directory, etc.
  715 |     |     function fsMetadata(string calldata path) external view returns (FsMetadata memory metadata);
  716 |     | 
  717 |     |     /// Gets the artifact path from code (aka. creation code).
  718 |     |     function getArtifactPathByCode(bytes calldata code) external view returns (string memory path);
  719 |     | 
  720 |     |     /// Gets the artifact path from deployed code (aka. runtime code).
  721 |     |     function getArtifactPathByDeployedCode(bytes calldata deployedCode) external view returns (string memory path);
  722 |     | 
  723 |     |     /// Returns the most recent broadcast for the given contract on `chainId` matching `txType`.
  724 |     |     /// For example:
  725 |     |     /// The most recent deployment can be fetched by passing `txType` as `CREATE` or `CREATE2`.
  726 |     |     /// The most recent call can be fetched by passing `txType` as `CALL`.
  727 |     |     function getBroadcast(string calldata contractName, uint64 chainId, BroadcastTxType txType)
  728 |     |         external
  729 |     |         view
  730 |     |         returns (BroadcastTxSummary memory);
  731 |     | 
  732 |     |     /// Returns all broadcasts for the given contract on `chainId` with the specified `txType`.
  733 |     |     /// Sorted such that the most recent broadcast is the first element, and the oldest is the last. i.e descending order of BroadcastTxSummary.blockNumber.
  734 |     |     function getBroadcasts(string calldata contractName, uint64 chainId, BroadcastTxType txType)
  735 |     |         external
  736 |     |         view
  737 |     |         returns (BroadcastTxSummary[] memory);
  738 |     | 
  739 |     |     /// Returns all broadcasts for the given contract on `chainId`.
  740 |     |     /// Sorted such that the most recent broadcast is the first element, and the oldest is the last. i.e descending order of BroadcastTxSummary.blockNumber.
  741 |     |     function getBroadcasts(string calldata contractName, uint64 chainId)
  742 |     |         external
  743 |     |         view
  744 |     |         returns (BroadcastTxSummary[] memory);
  745 |     | 
  746 |     |     /// Gets the creation bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  747 |     |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  748 |     |     function getCode(string calldata artifactPath) external view returns (bytes memory creationBytecode);
  749 |     | 
  750 |     |     /// Gets the deployed bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  751 |     |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  752 |     |     function getDeployedCode(string calldata artifactPath) external view returns (bytes memory runtimeBytecode);
  753 |     | 
  754 |     |     /// Returns the most recent deployment for the current `chainId`.
  755 |     |     function getDeployment(string calldata contractName) external view returns (address deployedAddress);
  756 |     | 
  757 |     |     /// Returns the most recent deployment for the given contract on `chainId`
  758 |     |     function getDeployment(string calldata contractName, uint64 chainId)
  759 |     |         external
  760 |     |         view
  761 |     |         returns (address deployedAddress);
  762 |     | 
  763 |     |     /// Returns all deployments for the given contract on `chainId`
  764 |     |     /// Sorted in descending order of deployment time i.e descending order of BroadcastTxSummary.blockNumber.
  765 |     |     /// The most recent deployment is the first element, and the oldest is the last.
  766 |     |     function getDeployments(string calldata contractName, uint64 chainId)
  767 |     |         external
  768 |     |         view
  769 |     |         returns (address[] memory deployedAddresses);
  770 |     | 
  771 |     |     /// Returns true if the path exists on disk and is pointing at a directory, else returns false.
  772 |     |     function isDir(string calldata path) external view returns (bool result);
  773 |     | 
  774 |     |     /// Returns true if the path exists on disk and is pointing at a regular file, else returns false.
  775 |     |     function isFile(string calldata path) external view returns (bool result);
  776 |     | 
  777 |     |     /// Get the path of the current project root.
  778 |     |     function projectRoot() external view returns (string memory path);
  779 |     | 
  780 |     |     /// Prompts the user for a string value in the terminal.
  781 |     |     function prompt(string calldata promptText) external returns (string memory input);
  782 |     | 
  783 |     |     /// Prompts the user for an address in the terminal.
  784 |     |     function promptAddress(string calldata promptText) external returns (address);
  785 |     | 
  786 |     |     /// Prompts the user for a hidden string value in the terminal.
  787 |     |     function promptSecret(string calldata promptText) external returns (string memory input);
  788 |     | 
  789 |     |     /// Prompts the user for hidden uint256 in the terminal (usually pk).
  790 |     |     function promptSecretUint(string calldata promptText) external returns (uint256);
  791 |     | 
  792 |     |     /// Prompts the user for uint256 in the terminal.
  793 |     |     function promptUint(string calldata promptText) external returns (uint256);
  794 |     | 
  795 |     |     /// Reads the directory at the given path recursively, up to `maxDepth`.
  796 |     |     /// `maxDepth` defaults to 1, meaning only the direct children of the given directory will be returned.
  797 |     |     /// Follows symbolic links if `followLinks` is true.
  798 |     |     function readDir(string calldata path) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  799 |     | 
  800 |     |     /// See `readDir(string)`.
  801 |     |     function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  802 |     | 
  803 |     |     /// See `readDir(string)`.
  804 |     |     function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth, bool followLinks)
  805 |     |         external
  806 |     |         view
  807 |     |         returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  808 |     | 
  809 |     |     /// Reads the entire content of file to string. `path` is relative to the project root.
  810 |     |     function readFile(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory data);
  811 |     | 
  812 |     |     /// Reads the entire content of file as binary. `path` is relative to the project root.
  813 |     |     function readFileBinary(string calldata path) external view returns (bytes memory data);
  814 |     | 
  815 |     |     /// Reads next line of file to string.
  816 |     |     function readLine(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory line);
  817 |     | 
  818 |     |     /// Reads a symbolic link, returning the path that the link points to.
  819 |     |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  820 |     |     /// - `path` is not a symbolic link.
  821 |     |     /// - `path` does not exist.
  822 |     |     function readLink(string calldata linkPath) external view returns (string memory targetPath);
  823 |     | 
  824 |     |     /// Removes a directory at the provided path.
  825 |     |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  826 |     |     /// - `path` doesn't exist.
  827 |     |     /// - `path` isn't a directory.
  828 |     |     /// - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
  829 |     |     /// - The directory is not empty and `recursive` is false.
  830 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  831 |     |     function removeDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
  832 |     | 
  833 |     |     /// Removes a file from the filesystem.
  834 |     |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  835 |     |     /// - `path` points to a directory.
  836 |     |     /// - The file doesn't exist.
  837 |     |     /// - The user lacks permissions to remove the file.
  838 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  839 |     |     function removeFile(string calldata path) external;
  840 |     | 
  841 |     |     /// Performs a foreign function call via terminal and returns the exit code, stdout, and stderr.
  842 |     |     function tryFfi(string[] calldata commandInput) external returns (FfiResult memory result);
  843 |     | 
  844 |     |     /// Returns the time since unix epoch in milliseconds.
  845 |     |     function unixTime() external view returns (uint256 milliseconds);
  846 |     | 
  847 |     |     /// Writes data to file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does.
  848 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  849 |     |     function writeFile(string calldata path, string calldata data) external;
  850 |     | 
  851 |     |     /// Writes binary data to a file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does.
  852 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  853 |     |     function writeFileBinary(string calldata path, bytes calldata data) external;
  854 |     | 
  855 |     |     /// Writes line to file, creating a file if it does not exist.
  856 |     |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  857 |     |     function writeLine(string calldata path, string calldata data) external;
  858 |     | 
  859 |     |     // ======== JSON ========

  863 |     |

  865 |     |     function parseJsonAddress(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (address);
  866 |     |

  869 |     |         external
  870 |     |         pure
  871 |     |         returns (address[] memory);
  872 |     |

  874 |     |     function parseJsonBool(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bool);
  875 |     | 
  876 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `bool[]`.
  877 |     |     function parseJsonBoolArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bool[] memory);
  878 |     | 
  879 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes`.
  880 |     |     function parseJsonBytes(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes memory);
  881 |     | 
  882 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes32`.
  883 |     |     function parseJsonBytes32(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes32);
  884 |     |

  886 |     |     function parseJsonBytes32Array(string calldata json, string calldata key)
  887 |     |         external
  888 |     |         pure
  889 |     |         returns (bytes32[] memory);
  890 |     | 
  891 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes[]`.
  892 |     |     function parseJsonBytesArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes[] memory);
  893 |     | 
  894 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `int256`.
  895 |     |     function parseJsonInt(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (int256);
  896 |     | 
  897 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `int256[]`.
  898 |     |     function parseJsonIntArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (int256[] memory);
  899 |     | 
  900 |     |     /// Returns an array of all the keys in a JSON object.
  901 |     |     function parseJsonKeys(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (string[] memory keys);
  902 |     | 
  903 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `string`.
  904 |     |     function parseJsonString(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (string memory);
  905 |     | 
  906 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `string[]`.
  907 |     |     function parseJsonStringArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (string[] memory);
  908 |     | 
  909 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to type array corresponding to `typeDescription`.

  911 |     |         external
  912 |     |         pure
  913 |     |         returns (bytes memory);
  914 |     | 
  915 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data and coerces it to type corresponding to `typeDescription`.

  917 |     |         external
  918 |     |         pure
  919 |     |         returns (bytes memory);
  920 |     | 
  921 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to type corresponding to `typeDescription`.
  922 |     |     function parseJsonType(string calldata json, string calldata key, string calldata typeDescription)
  923 |     |         external
  924 |     |         pure
  925 |     |         returns (bytes memory);
  926 |     |

  929 |     | 
  930 |     |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `uint256[]`.
  931 |     |     function parseJsonUintArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256[] memory);
  932 |     | 
  933 |     |     /// ABI-encodes a JSON object.
  934 |     |     function parseJson(string calldata json) external pure returns (bytes memory abiEncodedData);
  935 |     | 
  936 |     |     /// ABI-encodes a JSON object at `key`.
  937 |     |     function parseJson(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes memory abiEncodedData);
  938 |     | 
  939 |     |     /// See `serializeJson`.

  988 |     | 
  989 |     |     /// Serializes a key and value to a JSON object stored in-memory that can be later written to a file.
  990 |     |     /// Returns the stringified version of the specific JSON file up to that moment.

 1003 |     |         string calldata typeDescription,
 1004 |     |         bytes calldata value
 1005 |     |     ) external returns (string memory json);
 1006 |     |

 1009 |     |         external
 1010 |     |         returns (string memory json);
 1011 |     |

 1014 |     |         external

 1019 |     |         external
 1020 |     |         returns (string memory json);

 1024 |     |         external
 1025 |     |         returns (string memory json);
 1026 |     |

 1029 |     |         external

 1031 |     | 
 1032 |     |     /// Write a serialized JSON object to a file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
 1033 |     |     function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path) external;
 1034 |     | 
 1035 |     |     /// Write a serialized JSON object to an **existing** JSON file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
 1036 |     |     /// This is useful to replace a specific value of a JSON file, without having to parse the entire thing.
 1037 |     |     function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;
 1038 |     | 
 1039 |     |     /// Checks if `key` exists in a JSON object
 1040 |     |     /// `keyExists` is being deprecated in favor of `keyExistsJson`. It will be removed in future versions.
 1041 |     |     function keyExists(string calldata json, string calldata key) external view returns (bool);
 1042 |     | 
 1043 |     |     // ======== Scripting ========
 1044 |     | 
 1045 |     |     /// Designate the next call as an EIP-7702 transaction
 1046 |     |     function attachDelegation(SignedDelegation calldata signedDelegation) external;
 1047 |     | 
 1048 |     |     /// Takes a signed transaction and broadcasts it to the network.
 1049 |     |     function broadcastRawTransaction(bytes calldata data) external;
 1050 |     | 
 1051 |     |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1052 |     |     /// Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
 1053 |     |     /// 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
 1054 |     |     /// 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
 1055 |     |     /// 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
 1056 |     |     function broadcast() external;
 1057 |     | 
 1058 |     |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the address provided
 1059 |     |     /// as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1060 |     |     function broadcast(address signer) external;
 1061 |     | 
 1062 |     |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the private key
 1063 |     |     /// provided as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1064 |     |     function broadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
 1065 |     | 
 1066 |     |     /// Returns addresses of available unlocked wallets in the script environment.
 1067 |     |     function getWallets() external returns (address[] memory wallets);
 1068 |     | 
 1069 |     |     /// Sign an EIP-7702 authorization and designate the next call as an EIP-7702 transaction
 1070 |     |     function signAndAttachDelegation(address implementation, uint256 privateKey)
 1071 |     |         external
 1072 |     |         returns (SignedDelegation memory signedDelegation);
 1073 |     | 
 1074 |     |     /// Sign an EIP-7702 authorization for delegation
 1075 |     |     function signDelegation(address implementation, uint256 privateKey)
 1076 |     |         external
 1077 |     |         returns (SignedDelegation memory signedDelegation);
 1078 |     | 
 1079 |     |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1080 |     |     /// Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
 1081 |     |     /// 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
 1082 |     |     /// 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
 1083 |     |     /// 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
 1084 |     |     function startBroadcast() external;
 1085 |     | 
 1086 |     |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the address
 1087 |     |     /// provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1088 |     |     function startBroadcast(address signer) external;
 1089 |     | 
 1090 |     |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the private key
 1091 |     |     /// provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1092 |     |     function startBroadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
 1093 |     | 
 1094 |     |     /// Stops collecting onchain transactions.
 1095 |     |     function stopBroadcast() external;
 1096 |     | 
 1097 |     |     // ======== String ========
 1098 |     | 
 1099 |     |     /// Returns true if `search` is found in `subject`, false otherwise.
 1100 |     |     function contains(string calldata subject, string calldata search) external returns (bool result);
 1101 |     | 
 1102 |     |     /// Returns the index of the first occurrence of a `key` in an `input` string.
 1103 |     |     /// Returns `NOT_FOUND` (i.e. `type(uint256).max`) if the `key` is not found.
 1104 |     |     /// Returns 0 in case of an empty `key`.
 1105 |     |     function indexOf(string calldata input, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256);
 1106 |     | 
 1107 |     |     /// Parses the given `string` into an `address`.
 1108 |     |     function parseAddress(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (address parsedValue);
 1109 |     | 
 1110 |     |     /// Parses the given `string` into a `bool`.

 1504 |     |     /// Asserts that two `bool` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1505 |     |     function assertNotEq(bool left, bool right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1506 |     | 
 1507 |     |     /// Asserts that two `string` values are not equal.
 1508 |     |     function assertNotEq(string calldata left, string calldata right) external pure;
 1509 |     | 
 1510 |     |     /// Asserts that two `string` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1511 |     |     function assertNotEq(string calldata left, string calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1512 |     | 
 1513 |     |     /// Asserts that two `bytes` values are not equal.
 1514 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes calldata left, bytes calldata right) external pure;
 1515 |     | 
 1516 |     |     /// Asserts that two `bytes` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1517 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes calldata left, bytes calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1518 |     |

 1520 |     |     function assertNotEq(bool[] calldata left, bool[] calldata right) external pure;
 1521 |     |

 1523 |     |     function assertNotEq(bool[] calldata left, bool[] calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;

 1538 |     |     function assertNotEq(uint256 left, uint256 right) external pure;
 1539 |     |

 1544 |     |     function assertNotEq(address[] calldata left, address[] calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;

 1554 |     | 
 1555 |     |     /// Asserts that two arrays of `string` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1556 |     |     function assertNotEq(string[] calldata left, string[] calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1557 |     | 
 1558 |     |     /// Asserts that two arrays of `bytes` values are not equal.
 1559 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes[] calldata left, bytes[] calldata right) external pure;
 1560 |     | 
 1561 |     |     /// Asserts that two arrays of `bytes` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1562 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes[] calldata left, bytes[] calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1563 |     | 
 1564 |     |     /// Asserts that two `uint256` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1565 |     |     function assertNotEq(uint256 left, uint256 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1566 |     | 
 1567 |     |     /// Asserts that two `int256` values are not equal.
 1568 |     |     function assertNotEq(int256 left, int256 right) external pure;
 1569 |     | 
 1570 |     |     /// Asserts that two `int256` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1571 |     |     function assertNotEq(int256 left, int256 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1572 |     | 
 1573 |     |     /// Asserts that two `address` values are not equal.
 1574 |     |     function assertNotEq(address left, address right) external pure;
 1575 |     | 
 1576 |     |     /// Asserts that two `address` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1577 |     |     function assertNotEq(address left, address right, string calldata error) external pure;

 1580 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes32 left, bytes32 right) external pure;
 1581 |     | 
 1582 |     |     /// Asserts that two `bytes32` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1583 |     |     function assertNotEq(bytes32 left, bytes32 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1584 |     | 
 1585 |     |     /// Asserts that the given condition is true.
 1586 |     |     function assertTrue(bool condition) external pure;
 1587 |     | 
 1588 |     |     /// Asserts that the given condition is true and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1589 |     |     function assertTrue(bool condition, string calldata error) external pure;
 1590 |     | 
 1591 |     |     /// If the condition is false, discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones.
 1592 |     |     function assume(bool condition) external pure;
 1593 |     | 
 1594 |     |     /// Discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones if next call reverted.
 1595 |     |     function assumeNoRevert() external pure;
 1596 |     | 
 1597 |     |     /// Writes a breakpoint to jump to in the debugger.
 1598 |     |     function breakpoint(string calldata char) external pure;
 1599 |     | 
 1600 |     |     /// Writes a conditional breakpoint to jump to in the debugger.
 1601 |     |     function breakpoint(string calldata char, bool value) external pure;
 1602 |     | 
 1603 |     |     /// Returns the Foundry version.
 1604 |     |     /// Format: <cargo_version>+<git_sha>+<build_timestamp>
 1605 |     |     /// Sample output: 0.2.0+faa94c384+202407110019
 1606 |     |     /// Note: Build timestamps may vary slightly across platforms due to separate CI jobs.
 1607 |     |     /// For reliable version comparisons, use YYYYMMDD0000 format (e.g., >= 202407110000)
 1608 |     |     /// to compare timestamps while ignoring minor time differences.
 1609 |     |     function getFoundryVersion() external view returns (string memory version);
 1610 |     | 
 1611 |     |     /// Returns the RPC url for the given alias.
 1612 |     |     function rpcUrl(string calldata rpcAlias) external view returns (string memory json);
 1613 |     |

 1615 |     |     function rpcUrlStructs() external view returns (Rpc[] memory urls);
 1616 |     | 
 1617 |     |     /// Returns all rpc urls and their aliases `[alias, url][]`.
 1618 |     |     function rpcUrls() external view returns (string[2][] memory urls);
 1619 |     | 
 1620 |     |     /// Suspends execution of the main thread for `duration` milliseconds.
 1621 |     |     function sleep(uint256 duration) external;

 1672 |     |

 1675 |     |         external
 1676 |     |         pure
 1677 |     |         returns (bytes memory);

 1683 |     |         returns (bytes memory);

 1687 |     |         external
 1688 |     |         pure
 1689 |     |         returns (bytes memory);

 1699 |     | 
 1700 |     |     /// ABI-encodes a TOML table at `key`.

 1702 |     |

 1704 |     |     function writeToml(string calldata json, string calldata path) external;
 1705 |     | 
 1706 |     |     /// Takes serialized JSON, converts to TOML and write a serialized TOML table to an **existing** TOML file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
 1707 |     |     /// This is useful to replace a specific value of a TOML file, without having to parse the entire thing.
 1708 |     |     function writeToml(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;

 1710 |     |     // ======== Utilities ========
 1711 |     | 
 1712 |     |     /// Compute the address of a contract created with CREATE2 using the given CREATE2 deployer.
 1713 |     |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initCodeHash, address deployer)
 1714 |     |         external
 1715 |     |         pure
 1716 |     |         returns (address);
 1717 |     | 
 1718 |     |     /// Compute the address of a contract created with CREATE2 using the default CREATE2 deployer.
 1719 |     |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initCodeHash) external pure returns (address);
 1720 |     | 
 1721 |     |     /// Compute the address a contract will be deployed at for a given deployer address and nonce.
 1722 |     |     function computeCreateAddress(address deployer, uint256 nonce) external pure returns (address);
 1723 |     | 
 1724 |     |     /// Utility cheatcode to copy storage of `from` contract to another `to` contract.
 1725 |     |     function copyStorage(address from, address to) external;
 1726 |     | 
 1727 |     |     /// Returns ENS namehash for provided string.
 1728 |     |     function ensNamehash(string calldata name) external pure returns (bytes32);
 1729 |     | 
 1730 |     |     /// Gets the label for the specified address.
 1731 |     |     function getLabel(address account) external view returns (string memory currentLabel);
 1732 |     | 
 1733 |     |     /// Labels an address in call traces.
 1734 |     |     function label(address account, string calldata newLabel) external;
 1735 |     | 
 1736 |     |     /// Pauses collection of call traces. Useful in cases when you want to skip tracing of
 1737 |     |     /// complex calls which are not useful for debugging.
 1738 |     |     function pauseTracing() external view;
 1739 |     | 
 1740 |     |     /// Returns a random `address`.
 1741 |     |     function randomAddress() external returns (address);
 1742 |     | 
 1743 |     |     /// Returns a random `bool`.
 1744 |     |     function randomBool() external view returns (bool);
 1745 |     | 
 1746 |     |     /// Returns a random byte array value of the given length.
 1747 |     |     function randomBytes(uint256 len) external view returns (bytes memory);
 1748 |     | 
 1749 |     |     /// Returns a random fixed-size byte array of length 4.
 1750 |     |     function randomBytes4() external view returns (bytes4);
 1751 |     | 
 1752 |     |     /// Returns a random fixed-size byte array of length 8.
 1753 |     |     function randomBytes8() external view returns (bytes8);
 1754 |     | 
 1755 |     |     /// Returns a random `int256` value.
 1756 |     |     function randomInt() external view returns (int256);
 1757 |     | 
 1758 |     |     /// Returns a random `int256` value of given bits.
 1759 |     |     function randomInt(uint256 bits) external view returns (int256);
 1760 |     | 
 1761 |     |     /// Returns a random uint256 value.
 1762 |     |     function randomUint() external returns (uint256);
 1763 |     | 
 1764 |     |     /// Returns random uint256 value between the provided range (=min..=max).
 1765 |     |     function randomUint(uint256 min, uint256 max) external returns (uint256);
 1766 |     | 
 1767 |     |     /// Returns a random `uint256` value of given bits.
 1768 |     |     function randomUint(uint256 bits) external view returns (uint256);
 1769 |     | 
 1770 |     |     /// Unpauses collection of call traces.
 1771 |     |     function resumeTracing() external view;
 1772 |     | 
 1773 |     |     /// Utility cheatcode to set arbitrary storage for given target address.
 1774 |     |     function setArbitraryStorage(address target) external;
 1775 |     | 
 1776 |     |     /// Encodes a `bytes` value to a base64url string.
 1777 |     |     function toBase64URL(bytes calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1778 |     | 
 1779 |     |     /// Encodes a `string` value to a base64url string.
 1780 |     |     function toBase64URL(string calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1781 |     | 
 1782 |     |     /// Encodes a `bytes` value to a base64 string.
 1783 |     |     function toBase64(bytes calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1784 |     | 
 1785 |     |     /// Encodes a `string` value to a base64 string.
 1786 |     |     function toBase64(string calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1787 |     | }
 1788 |     | 
 1789 |     | /// The `Vm` interface does allow manipulation of the EVM state. These are all intended to be used
 1790 |     | /// in tests, but it is not recommended to use these cheats in scripts.
 1791 |     | interface Vm is VmSafe {
 1792 |     |     // ======== EVM ========
 1793 |     | 
 1794 |     |     /// Returns the identifier of the currently active fork. Reverts if no fork is currently active.
 1795 |     |     function activeFork() external view returns (uint256 forkId);
 1796 |     | 
 1797 |     |     /// In forking mode, explicitly grant the given address cheatcode access.
 1798 |     |     function allowCheatcodes(address account) external;
 1799 |     | 
 1800 |     |     /// Sets `block.blobbasefee`
 1801 |     |     function blobBaseFee(uint256 newBlobBaseFee) external;
 1802 |     | 
 1803 |     |     /// Sets the blobhashes in the transaction.
 1804 |     |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
 1805 |     |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1806 |     |     function blobhashes(bytes32[] calldata hashes) external;
 1807 |     | 
 1808 |     |     /// Sets `block.chainid`.
 1809 |     |     function chainId(uint256 newChainId) external;
 1810 |     | 
 1811 |     |     /// Clears all mocked calls.
 1812 |     |     function clearMockedCalls() external;
 1813 |     | 
 1814 |     |     /// Clones a source account code, state, balance and nonce to a target account and updates in-memory EVM state.
 1815 |     |     function cloneAccount(address source, address target) external;
 1816 |     | 
 1817 |     |     /// Sets `block.coinbase`.
 1818 |     |     function coinbase(address newCoinbase) external;
 1819 |     | 
 1820 |     |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and the _latest_ block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1821 |     |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1822 |     | 
 1823 |     |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1824 |     |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1825 |     | 
 1826 |     |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
 1827 |     |     /// replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1828 |     |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1829 |     | 
 1830 |     |     /// Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and the latest block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1831 |     |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1832 |     | 
 1833 |     |     /// Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1834 |     |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1835 |     | 
 1836 |     |     /// Creates and also selects new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
 1837 |     |     /// replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, returns the identifier of the fork.
 1838 |     |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1839 |     | 
 1840 |     |     /// Sets an address' balance.
 1841 |     |     function deal(address account, uint256 newBalance) external;
 1842 |     | 
 1843 |     |     /// Removes the snapshot with the given ID created by `snapshot`.
 1844 |     |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to delete.
 1845 |     |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully deleted.
 1846 |     |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1847 |     |     function deleteStateSnapshot(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1848 |     | 
 1849 |     |     /// Removes _all_ snapshots previously created by `snapshot`.
 1850 |     |     function deleteStateSnapshots() external;
 1851 |     | 
 1852 |     |     /// Sets `block.difficulty`.
 1853 |     |     /// Not available on EVM versions from Paris onwards. Use `prevrandao` instead.
 1854 |     |     /// Reverts if used on unsupported EVM versions.
 1855 |     |     function difficulty(uint256 newDifficulty) external;
 1856 |     | 
 1857 |     |     /// Dump a genesis JSON file's `allocs` to disk.
 1858 |     |     function dumpState(string calldata pathToStateJson) external;
 1859 |     | 
 1860 |     |     /// Sets an address' code.
 1861 |     |     function etch(address target, bytes calldata newRuntimeBytecode) external;
 1862 |     | 
 1863 |     |     /// Sets `block.basefee`.
 1864 |     |     function fee(uint256 newBasefee) external;
 1865 |     | 
 1866 |     |     /// Gets the blockhashes from the current transaction.
 1867 |     |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
 1868 |     |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1869 |     |     function getBlobhashes() external view returns (bytes32[] memory hashes);
 1870 |     | 
 1871 |     |     /// Returns true if the account is marked as persistent.
 1872 |     |     function isPersistent(address account) external view returns (bool persistent);
 1873 |     | 
 1874 |     |     /// Load a genesis JSON file's `allocs` into the in-memory EVM state.
 1875 |     |     function loadAllocs(string calldata pathToAllocsJson) external;
 1876 |     | 
 1877 |     |     /// Marks that the account(s) should use persistent storage across fork swaps in a multifork setup
 1878 |     |     /// Meaning, changes made to the state of this account will be kept when switching forks.
 1879 |     |     function makePersistent(address account) external;
 1880 |     | 
 1881 |     |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1882 |     |     function makePersistent(address account0, address account1) external;
 1883 |     | 
 1884 |     |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1885 |     |     function makePersistent(address account0, address account1, address account2) external;
 1886 |     | 
 1887 |     |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1888 |     |     function makePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
 1889 |     | 
 1890 |     |     /// Reverts a call to an address with specified revert data.
 1891 |     |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
 1892 |     | 
 1893 |     |     /// Reverts a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, with specified revert data.
 1894 |     |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData)
 1895 |     |         external;
 1896 |     | 
 1897 |     |     /// Reverts a call to an address with specified revert data.
 1898 |     |     /// Overload to pass the function selector directly `token.approve.selector` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector(token.approve.selector)`.
 1899 |     |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, bytes4 data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
 1900 |     | 
 1901 |     |     /// Reverts a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, with specified revert data.
 1902 |     |     /// Overload to pass the function selector directly `token.approve.selector` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector(token.approve.selector)`.
 1903 |     |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes4 data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
 1904 |     | 
 1905 |     |     /// Mocks a call to an address, returning specified data.
 1906 |     |     /// Calldata can either be strict or a partial match, e.g. if you only
 1907 |     |     /// pass a Solidity selector to the expected calldata, then the entire Solidity
 1908 |     |     /// function will be mocked.
 1909 |     |     function mockCall(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1910 |     | 
 1911 |     |     /// Mocks a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, returning specified data.
 1912 |     |     /// Calldata match takes precedence over `msg.value` in case of ambiguity.
 1913 |     |     function mockCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1914 |     | 
 1915 |     |     /// Mocks a call to an address, returning specified data.
 1916 |     |     /// Calldata can either be strict or a partial match, e.g. if you only
 1917 |     |     /// pass a Solidity selector to the expected calldata, then the entire Solidity
 1918 |     |     /// function will be mocked.
 1919 |     |     /// Overload to pass the function selector directly `token.approve.selector` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector(token.approve.selector)`.
 1920 |     |     function mockCall(address callee, bytes4 data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1921 |     | 
 1922 |     |     /// Mocks a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, returning specified data.
 1923 |     |     /// Calldata match takes precedence over `msg.value` in case of ambiguity.
 1924 |     |     /// Overload to pass the function selector directly `token.approve.selector` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector(token.approve.selector)`.
 1925 |     |     function mockCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes4 data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1926 |     | 
 1927 |     |     /// Mocks multiple calls to an address, returning specified data for each call.
 1928 |     |     function mockCalls(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes[] calldata returnData) external;
 1929 |     | 
 1930 |     |     /// Mocks multiple calls to an address with a specific `msg.value`, returning specified data for each call.
 1931 |     |     function mockCalls(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes[] calldata returnData) external;
 1932 |     | 
 1933 |     |     /// Whenever a call is made to `callee` with calldata `data`, this cheatcode instead calls
 1934 |     |     /// `target` with the same calldata. This functionality is similar to a delegate call made to
 1935 |     |     /// `target` contract from `callee`.
 1936 |     |     /// Can be used to substitute a call to a function with another implementation that captures
 1937 |     |     /// the primary logic of the original function but is easier to reason about.
 1938 |     |     /// If calldata is not a strict match then partial match by selector is attempted.
 1939 |     |     function mockFunction(address callee, address target, bytes calldata data) external;
 1940 |     | 
 1941 |     |     /// Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address.
 1942 |     |     function prank(address msgSender) external;
 1943 |     | 
 1944 |     |     /// Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
 1945 |     |     function prank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) external;
 1946 |     | 
 1947 |     |     /// Sets the *next* delegate call's `msg.sender` to be the input address.
 1948 |     |     function prank(address msgSender, bool delegateCall) external;
 1949 |     | 
 1950 |     |     /// Sets the *next* delegate call's `msg.sender` to be the input address, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
 1951 |     |     function prank(address msgSender, address txOrigin, bool delegateCall) external;
 1952 |     | 
 1953 |     |     /// Sets `block.prevrandao`.
 1954 |     |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
 1955 |     |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1956 |     |     function prevrandao(bytes32 newPrevrandao) external;
 1957 |     | 
 1958 |     |     /// Sets `block.prevrandao`.
 1959 |     |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
 1960 |     |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1961 |     |     function prevrandao(uint256 newPrevrandao) external;
 1962 |     | 
 1963 |     |     /// Reads the current `msg.sender` and `tx.origin` from state and reports if there is any active caller modification.
 1964 |     |     function readCallers() external returns (CallerMode callerMode, address msgSender, address txOrigin);
 1965 |     | 
 1966 |     |     /// Resets the nonce of an account to 0 for EOAs and 1 for contract accounts.
 1967 |     |     function resetNonce(address account) external;
 1968 |     | 
 1969 |     |     /// Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot
 1970 |     |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
 1971 |     |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted.
 1972 |     |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1973 |     |     /// **Note:** This does not automatically delete the snapshot. To delete the snapshot use `deleteStateSnapshot`.
 1974 |     |     function revertToState(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1975 |     | 
 1976 |     |     /// Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot and automatically deletes the snapshots
 1977 |     |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
 1978 |     |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted and deleted.
 1979 |     |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1980 |     |     function revertToStateAndDelete(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1981 |     | 
 1982 |     |     /// Revokes persistent status from the address, previously added via `makePersistent`.
 1983 |     |     function revokePersistent(address account) external;
 1984 |     | 
 1985 |     |     /// See `revokePersistent(address)`.
 1986 |     |     function revokePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
 1987 |     | 
 1988 |     |     /// Sets `block.height`.
 1989 |     |     function roll(uint256 newHeight) external;
 1990 |     | 
 1991 |     |     /// Updates the currently active fork to given block number
 1992 |     |     /// This is similar to `roll` but for the currently active fork.
 1993 |     |     function rollFork(uint256 blockNumber) external;
 1994 |     | 
 1995 |     |     /// Updates the currently active fork to given transaction. This will `rollFork` with the number
 1996 |     |     /// of the block the transaction was mined in and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
 1997 |     |     function rollFork(bytes32 txHash) external;
 1998 |     | 
 1999 |     |     /// Updates the given fork to given block number.
 2000 |     |     function rollFork(uint256 forkId, uint256 blockNumber) external;
 2001 |     | 
 2002 |     |     /// Updates the given fork to block number of the given transaction and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
 2003 |     |     function rollFork(uint256 forkId, bytes32 txHash) external;
 2004 |     | 
 2005 |     |     /// Takes a fork identifier created by `createFork` and sets the corresponding forked state as active.
 2006 |     |     function selectFork(uint256 forkId) external;
 2007 |     | 
 2008 |     |     /// Set blockhash for the current block.
 2009 |     |     /// It only sets the blockhash for blocks where `block.number - 256 <= number < block.number`.
 2010 |     |     function setBlockhash(uint256 blockNumber, bytes32 blockHash) external;
 2011 |     | 
 2012 |     |     /// Sets the nonce of an account. Must be higher than the current nonce of the account.
 2013 |     |     function setNonce(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
 2014 |     | 
 2015 |     |     /// Sets the nonce of an account to an arbitrary value.
 2016 |     |     function setNonceUnsafe(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
 2017 |     |

 2128 |     |     /// logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data (as specified by the booleans).
 2129 |     |     function expectEmitAnonymous(bool checkTopic0, bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData)

 2228 |     |     /// Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the current subcontext. If any other
 2229 |     |     /// memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges to the set.
 2230 |     |     function expectSafeMemory(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
 2231 |     | 
 2232 |     |     /// Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the next created subcontext.
 2233 |     |     /// If any other memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges
 2234 |     |     /// to the set.
 2235 |     |     function expectSafeMemoryCall(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
 2236 |     | 
 2237 |     |     /// Marks a test as skipped. Must be called at the top level of a test.
 2238 |     |     function skip(bool skipTest) external;
 2239 |     | 
 2240 |     |     /// Marks a test as skipped with a reason. Must be called at the top level of a test.
 2241 |     |     function skip(bool skipTest, string calldata reason) external;
 2242 |     | 
 2243 |     |     /// Stops all safe memory expectation in the current subcontext.
 2244 |     |     function stopExpectSafeMemory() external;
 2245 |     | }

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/lib/forge-std/src/console.sol
    1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
    2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0;
    3 |     | 
    4 |     | library console {
    5 |     |     address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS =
    6 |     |         0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67;
    7 |     | 
    8 |     |     function _sendLogPayloadImplementation(bytes memory payload) internal view {
    9 |     |         address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS;
   10 |     |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
   11 |     |         assembly {
   12 |     |             pop(
   13 |     |                 staticcall(
   14 |     |                     gas(),
   15 |     |                     consoleAddress,
   16 |     |                     add(payload, 32),
   17 |     |                     mload(payload),
   18 |     |                     0,
   19 |     |                     0
   20 |     |                 )
   21 |     |             )
   22 |     |         }
   23 |     |     }
   24 |     | 
   25 |     |     function _castToPure(
   26 |     |       function(bytes memory) internal view fnIn
   27 |     |     ) internal pure returns (function(bytes memory) pure fnOut) {
   28 |     |         assembly {
   29 |     |             fnOut := fnIn
   30 |     |         }
   31 |     |     }
   32 |     | 
   33 |     |     function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) internal pure {
   34 |     |         _castToPure(_sendLogPayloadImplementation)(payload);
   35 |     |     }
   36 |     | 
   37 |     |     function log() internal pure {
   38 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()"));
   39 |     |     }
   40 |     | 
   41 |     |     function logInt(int256 p0) internal pure {
   42 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(int256)", p0));
   43 |     |     }
   44 |     | 
   45 |     |     function logUint(uint256 p0) internal pure {
   46 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(uint256)", p0));
   47 |     |     }
   48 |     | 
   49 |     |     function logString(string memory p0) internal pure {
   50 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string)", p0));
   51 |     |     }
   52 |     | 
   53 |     |     function logBool(bool p0) internal pure {
   54 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bool)", p0));
   55 |     |     }
   56 |     | 
   57 |     |     function logAddress(address p0) internal pure {
   58 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(address)", p0));
   59 |     |     }
   60 |     | 
   61 |     |     function logBytes(bytes memory p0) internal pure {
   62 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes)", p0));
   63 |     |     }
   64 |     | 
   65 |     |     function logBytes1(bytes1 p0) internal pure {
   66 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes1)", p0));
   67 |     |     }
   68 |     | 
   69 |     |     function logBytes2(bytes2 p0) internal pure {
   70 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes2)", p0));
   71 |     |     }
   72 |     | 
   73 |     |     function logBytes3(bytes3 p0) internal pure {
   74 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes3)", p0));
   75 |     |     }
   76 |     | 
   77 |     |     function logBytes4(bytes4 p0) internal pure {
   78 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes4)", p0));
   79 |     |     }
   80 |     | 
   81 |     |     function logBytes5(bytes5 p0) internal pure {
   82 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes5)", p0));
   83 |     |     }
   84 |     | 
   85 |     |     function logBytes6(bytes6 p0) internal pure {
   86 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes6)", p0));
   87 |     |     }
   88 |     | 
   89 |     |     function logBytes7(bytes7 p0) internal pure {
   90 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes7)", p0));
   91 |     |     }
   92 |     | 
   93 |     |     function logBytes8(bytes8 p0) internal pure {
   94 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes8)", p0));
   95 |     |     }
   96 |     | 
   97 |     |     function logBytes9(bytes9 p0) internal pure {
   98 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes9)", p0));
   99 |     |     }
  100 |     | 
  101 |     |     function logBytes10(bytes10 p0) internal pure {
  102 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes10)", p0));
  103 |     |     }
  104 |     | 
  105 |     |     function logBytes11(bytes11 p0) internal pure {
  106 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes11)", p0));
  107 |     |     }
  108 |     | 
  109 |     |     function logBytes12(bytes12 p0) internal pure {
  110 |     |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes12)", p0));
  111 |     |     }

 1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0;
