 234 |     |     /* BORROW MANAGEMENT */
 235 |     | 
 236 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 237 |     |     function borrow(
 238 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 239 |     |         uint256 assets,
 240 |     |         uint256 shares,
 241 |     |         address onBehalf,
 242 |     |         address receiver
 243 |     |     ) external returns (uint256, uint256) {
 244 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 245 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 246 | *   |         require(UtilsLib.exactlyOneZero(assets, shares), ErrorsLib.INCONSISTENT_INPUT);
 247 | *   |         require(receiver != address(0), ErrorsLib.ZERO_ADDRESS);
 248 |     |         // No need to verify that onBehalf != address(0) thanks to the following authorization check.
 249 | *   |         require(_isSenderAuthorized(onBehalf), ErrorsLib.UNAUTHORIZED);
 250 |     | 
 251 | *   |         _accrueInterest(marketParams, id);
 252 |     | 
 253 | *   |         if (assets > 0) shares = assets.toSharesUp(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares); //@note
 254 |     |             // if only borrower
 255 |     | 
 256 | *   |         else assets = shares.toAssetsDown(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares);
 257 |     | 
 258 | *   |         position[id][onBehalf].borrowShares += shares.toUint128();
 259 | *   |         market[id].totalBorrowShares += shares.toUint128();
 260 | *   |         market[id].totalBorrowAssets += assets.toUint128();
 261 |     | 
 262 | *   |         require(_isHealthy(marketParams, id, onBehalf), ErrorsLib.INSUFFICIENT_COLLATERAL);
 263 | *   |         require(market[id].totalBorrowAssets <= market[id].totalSupplyAssets, ErrorsLib.INSUFFICIENT_LIQUIDITY);
 264 |     | 
 265 | *   |         emit EventsLib.Borrow(id, msg.sender, onBehalf, receiver, assets, shares);
 266 |     | 
 267 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.loanToken).safeTransfer(receiver, assets);
 268 |     | 
 269 |     |         return (assets, shares);
 270 |     |     }
 271 |     | 
 272 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 273 |     |     function repay(
 274 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 275 |     |         uint256 assets,
 276 |     |         uint256 shares,
 277 |     |         address onBehalf,
 278 |     |         bytes calldata data
 279 |     |     ) external returns (uint256, uint256) {
 280 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 281 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 282 | *   |         require(UtilsLib.exactlyOneZero(assets, shares), ErrorsLib.INCONSISTENT_INPUT);
 283 | *   |         require(onBehalf != address(0), ErrorsLib.ZERO_ADDRESS);
 284 |     | 
 285 | *   |         _accrueInterest(marketParams, id);
 286 |     | 
 287 | *   |         if (assets > 0) shares = assets.toSharesDown(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares);
 288 | *   |         else assets = shares.toAssetsUp(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares);
 289 |     | 
 290 | *   |         position[id][onBehalf].borrowShares -= shares.toUint128();
 291 | *   |         market[id].totalBorrowShares -= shares.toUint128();

 294 |     |         // `assets` may be greater than `totalBorrowAssets` by 1.
 295 | *   |         emit EventsLib.Repay(id, msg.sender, onBehalf, assets, shares);

 297 | *   |         if (data.length > 0) IMorphoRepayCallback(msg.sender).onMorphoRepay(assets, data);
 298 |     | 
 299 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.loanToken).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), assets);
 300 |     | 
 301 |     |         return (assets, shares);
 302 |     |     }
 303 |     | 
 304 |     |     /* COLLATERAL MANAGEMENT */
 305 |     | 
 306 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 307 |     |     function supplyCollateral(MarketParams memory marketParams, uint256 assets, address onBehalf, bytes calldata data)
 308 |     |         external
 309 |     |     {
 310 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 311 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 312 | *   |         require(assets != 0, ErrorsLib.ZERO_ASSETS);
 313 | *   |         require(onBehalf != address(0), ErrorsLib.ZERO_ADDRESS);
 314 |     | 
 315 |     |         // Don't accrue interest because it's not required and it saves gas.
 316 |     | 
 317 | *   |         position[id][onBehalf].collateral += assets.toUint128();
 318 |     | 
 319 | *   |         emit EventsLib.SupplyCollateral(id, msg.sender, onBehalf, assets);
 320 |     | 
 321 | *   |         if (data.length > 0) IMorphoSupplyCollateralCallback(msg.sender).onMorphoSupplyCollateral(assets, data);
 322 |     | 
 323 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.collateralToken).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), assets);
 324 |     |     }
 325 |     | 
 326 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 327 |     |     function withdrawCollateral(MarketParams memory marketParams, uint256 assets, address onBehalf, address receiver)
 328 |     |         external
 329 |     |     {
 330 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 331 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 332 | *   |         require(assets != 0, ErrorsLib.ZERO_ASSETS);
 333 | *   |         require(receiver != address(0), ErrorsLib.ZERO_ADDRESS);
 334 |     |         // No need to verify that onBehalf != address(0) thanks to the following authorization check.
 335 | *   |         require(_isSenderAuthorized(onBehalf), ErrorsLib.UNAUTHORIZED);
 336 |     | 
 337 | *   |         _accrueInterest(marketParams, id);
 338 |     | 
 339 | *   |         position[id][onBehalf].collateral -= assets.toUint128();
 340 |     | 
 341 | *   |         require(_isHealthy(marketParams, id, onBehalf), ErrorsLib.INSUFFICIENT_COLLATERAL);
 342 |     | 
 343 | *   |         emit EventsLib.WithdrawCollateral(id, msg.sender, onBehalf, receiver, assets);
 344 |     | 
 345 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.collateralToken).safeTransfer(receiver, assets);
 346 |     |     }
 347 |     | 
 348 |     |     /* LIQUIDATION */
 349 |     | 
 350 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 351 |     |     function liquidate(
 352 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 353 |     |         address borrower,
 354 |     |         uint256 seizedAssets,
 355 |     |         uint256 repaidShares,
 356 |     |         bytes calldata data
 357 |     |     ) external returns (uint256, uint256) {
 358 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 359 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 360 | *   |         require(UtilsLib.exactlyOneZero(seizedAssets, repaidShares), ErrorsLib.INCONSISTENT_INPUT);
 361 |     | 
 362 | *   |         _accrueInterest(marketParams, id);
 363 |     | 
 364 |     |         {
 365 | *   |             uint256 collateralPrice = IOracle(marketParams.oracle).price();
 366 |     | 
 367 | *   |             require(!_isHealthy(marketParams, id, borrower, collateralPrice), ErrorsLib.HEALTHY_POSITION);
 368 |     | 
 369 |     |             // The liquidation incentive factor is min(maxLiquidationIncentiveFactor, 1/(1 - cursor*(1 - lltv))).
 370 |     |             uint256 liquidationIncentiveFactor = UtilsLib.min(
 371 |     |                 MAX_LIQUIDATION_INCENTIVE_FACTOR,
 372 | *   |                 WAD.wDivDown(WAD - LIQUIDATION_CURSOR.wMulDown(WAD - marketParams.lltv))
 373 |     |             );
 374 |     | 
 375 | *   |             if (seizedAssets > 0) {
 376 |     |                 uint256 seizedAssetsQuoted = seizedAssets.mulDivUp(collateralPrice, ORACLE_PRICE_SCALE);
 377 |     | 
 378 | *   |                 repaidShares = seizedAssetsQuoted.wDivUp(liquidationIncentiveFactor).toSharesUp(
 379 | *   |                     market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares
 380 |     |                 );
 381 |     |             } else {
 382 | *   |                 seizedAssets = repaidShares.toAssetsDown(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares)
 383 |     |                     .wMulDown(liquidationIncentiveFactor).mulDivDown(ORACLE_PRICE_SCALE, collateralPrice);
 384 |     |             }
 385 |     |         }
 386 | *   |         uint256 repaidAssets = repaidShares.toAssetsUp(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares);
 387 |     | 
 388 | *   |         position[id][borrower].borrowShares -= repaidShares.toUint128();
 389 | *   |         market[id].totalBorrowShares -= repaidShares.toUint128();
 390 | *   |         market[id].totalBorrowAssets = UtilsLib.zeroFloorSub(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, repaidAssets).toUint128();
 391 | *   |         position[id][borrower].collateral -= seizedAssets.toUint128();
 392 | *   |         uint256 badDebtShares;
 393 | *   |         uint256 badDebtAssets;
 394 | *   |         if (position[id][borrower].collateral == 0) {
 395 | *   |             badDebtShares = position[id][borrower].borrowShares;
 396 |     |             badDebtAssets = UtilsLib.min(
 397 | *   |                 market[id].totalBorrowAssets,
 398 | *   |                 badDebtShares.toAssetsUp(market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares)
 399 |     |             );
 400 |     | 
 401 | *   |             market[id].totalBorrowAssets -= badDebtAssets.toUint128();
 402 | *   |             market[id].totalSupplyAssets -= badDebtAssets.toUint128();
 403 | *   |             market[id].totalBorrowShares -= badDebtShares.toUint128();
 404 | *   |             position[id][borrower].borrowShares = 0;
 405 |     |         }
 406 |     | 
 407 |     |         // `repaidAssets` may be greater than `totalBorrowAssets` by 1.
 408 | *   |         emit EventsLib.Liquidate(
 409 | *   |             id, msg.sender, borrower, repaidAssets, repaidShares, seizedAssets, badDebtAssets, badDebtShares
 410 |     |         );
 411 |     | 
 412 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.collateralToken).safeTransfer(msg.sender, seizedAssets);
 413 |     | 
 414 | *   |         if (data.length > 0) IMorphoLiquidateCallback(msg.sender).onMorphoLiquidate(repaidAssets, data);
 415 |     | 
 416 | *   |         IERC20(marketParams.loanToken).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), repaidAssets);
 417 |     | 
 418 |     |         return (seizedAssets, repaidAssets);
 419 |     |     }
 420 |     | 
 421 |     |     /* FLASH LOANS */
 422 |     | 
 423 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 424 |     |     function flashLoan(address token, uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external {
 425 | *   |         require(assets != 0, ErrorsLib.ZERO_ASSETS);
 426 |     | 
 427 | *   |         emit EventsLib.FlashLoan(msg.sender, token, assets);
 428 |     | 
 429 | *   |         IERC20(token).safeTransfer(msg.sender, assets);
 430 |     | 
 431 | *   |         IMorphoFlashLoanCallback(msg.sender).onMorphoFlashLoan(assets, data);
 432 |     | 
 433 | *   |         IERC20(token).safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), assets);
 434 |     |     }
 435 |     | 
 436 |     |     /* AUTHORIZATION */
 437 |     | 
 438 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 439 |     |     function setAuthorization(address authorized, bool newIsAuthorized) external {
 440 | *   |         require(newIsAuthorized != isAuthorized[msg.sender][authorized], ErrorsLib.ALREADY_SET);
 441 |     | 
 442 | *   |         isAuthorized[msg.sender][authorized] = newIsAuthorized;
 443 |     | 
 444 | *   |         emit EventsLib.SetAuthorization(msg.sender, msg.sender, authorized, newIsAuthorized);
 445 |     |     }
 446 |     | 
 447 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 448 |     |     function setAuthorizationWithSig(Authorization memory authorization, Signature calldata signature) external {
 449 |     |         /// Do not check whether authorization is already set because the nonce increment is a desired side effect.
 450 |     |         require(block.timestamp <= authorization.deadline, ErrorsLib.SIGNATURE_EXPIRED);
 451 |     |         require(authorization.nonce == nonce[authorization.authorizer]++, ErrorsLib.INVALID_NONCE);
 452 |     | 
 453 |     |         bytes32 hashStruct = keccak256(abi.encode(AUTHORIZATION_TYPEHASH, authorization));
 454 |     |         bytes32 digest = keccak256(bytes.concat("\x19\x01", DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, hashStruct));
 455 |     |         address signatory = ecrecover(digest, signature.v, signature.r, signature.s);
 456 |     | 
 457 |     |         require(signatory != address(0) && authorization.authorizer == signatory, ErrorsLib.INVALID_SIGNATURE);
 458 |     | 
 459 |     |         emit EventsLib.IncrementNonce(msg.sender, authorization.authorizer, authorization.nonce);
 460 |     | 
 461 |     |         isAuthorized[authorization.authorizer][authorization.authorized] = authorization.isAuthorized;
 462 |     | 
 463 |     |         emit EventsLib.SetAuthorization(
 464 |     |             msg.sender, authorization.authorizer, authorization.authorized, authorization.isAuthorized
 465 |     |         );
 466 |     |     }
 467 |     | 
 468 |     |     /// @dev Returns whether the sender is authorized to manage `onBehalf`'s positions.
 469 | *   |     function _isSenderAuthorized(address onBehalf) internal view returns (bool) {
 470 | *   |         return msg.sender == onBehalf || isAuthorized[onBehalf][msg.sender];
 471 |     |     }
 472 |     | 
 473 |     |     /* INTEREST MANAGEMENT */
 474 |     | 
 475 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 476 |     |     function accrueInterest(MarketParams memory marketParams) external {
 477 |     |         Id id = marketParams.id();
 478 | *   |         require(market[id].lastUpdate != 0, ErrorsLib.MARKET_NOT_CREATED);
 479 |     | 
 480 | *   |         _accrueInterest(marketParams, id);
 481 |     |     }
 482 |     | 
 483 |     |     /// @dev Accrues interest for the given market `marketParams`.
 484 |     |     /// @dev Assumes that the inputs `marketParams` and `id` match.
 485 | *   |     function _accrueInterest(MarketParams memory marketParams, Id id) internal {
 486 | *   |         uint256 elapsed = block.timestamp - market[id].lastUpdate;
 487 | *   |         if (elapsed == 0) return;
 488 |     | 
 489 | *   |         if (marketParams.irm != address(0)) {
 490 | *   |             uint256 borrowRate = IIrm(marketParams.irm).borrowRate(marketParams, market[id]);
 491 | *   |             uint256 interest = market[id].totalBorrowAssets.wMulDown(borrowRate.wTaylorCompounded(elapsed));
 492 | *   |             market[id].totalBorrowAssets += interest.toUint128();
 493 | *   |             market[id].totalSupplyAssets += interest.toUint128();
 494 |     | 
 495 | *   |             uint256 feeShares;
 496 | *   |             if (market[id].fee != 0) {
 497 |     |                 uint256 feeAmount = interest.wMulDown(market[id].fee);
 498 |     |                 // The fee amount is subtracted from the total supply in this calculation to compensate for the fact
 499 |     |                 // that total supply is already increased by the full interest (including the fee amount).
 500 |     |                 feeShares =
 501 | *   |                     feeAmount.toSharesDown(market[id].totalSupplyAssets - feeAmount, market[id].totalSupplyShares);
 502 | *   |                 position[id][feeRecipient].supplyShares += feeShares;
 503 | *   |                 market[id].totalSupplyShares += feeShares.toUint128();
 504 |     |             }
 505 |     | 
 506 | *   |             emit EventsLib.AccrueInterest(id, borrowRate, interest, feeShares);
 507 |     |         }
 508 |     | 
 509 |     |         // Safe "unchecked" cast.
 510 | *   |         market[id].lastUpdate = uint128(block.timestamp);
 511 |     |     }
 512 |     | 
 513 |     |     /* HEALTH CHECK */
 514 |     | 
 515 |     |     /// @dev Returns whether the position of `borrower` in the given market `marketParams` is healthy.
 516 |     |     /// @dev Assumes that the inputs `marketParams` and `id` match.
 517 | *   |     function _isHealthy(MarketParams memory marketParams, Id id, address borrower) internal view returns (bool) {
 518 | *   |         if (position[id][borrower].borrowShares == 0) return true;
 519 |     | 
 520 | *   |         uint256 collateralPrice = IOracle(marketParams.oracle).price();
 521 |     | 
 522 | *   |         return _isHealthy(marketParams, id, borrower, collateralPrice);
 523 |     |     }
 524 |     | 
 525 |     |     /// @dev Returns whether the position of `borrower` in the given market `marketParams` with the given
 526 |     |     /// `collateralPrice` is healthy.
 527 |     |     /// @dev Assumes that the inputs `marketParams` and `id` match.
 528 |     |     /// @dev Rounds in favor of the protocol, so one might not be able to borrow exactly `maxBorrow` but one unit less.
 529 | *   |     function _isHealthy(MarketParams memory marketParams, Id id, address borrower, uint256 collateralPrice)
 530 |     |         internal
 531 |     |         view
 532 |     |         returns (bool)
 533 |     |     {
 534 | *   |         uint256 borrowed = uint256(position[id][borrower].borrowShares).toAssetsUp(
 535 | *   |             market[id].totalBorrowAssets, market[id].totalBorrowShares
 536 |     |         );
 537 | *   |         uint256 maxBorrow = uint256(position[id][borrower].collateral).mulDivDown(collateralPrice, ORACLE_PRICE_SCALE)
 538 | *   |             .wMulDown(marketParams.lltv);
 539 |     |         // 1000e18 * 1e18 / 1e36
 540 | *   |         return maxBorrow >= borrowed;
 541 |     |     }
 542 |     | 
 543 |     |     /* STORAGE VIEW */
 544 |     | 
 545 |     |     /// @inheritdoc IMorphoBase
 546 |     |     function extSloads(bytes32[] calldata slots) external view returns (bytes32[] memory res) {
 547 |     |         uint256 nSlots = slots.length;
 548 |     | 
 549 |     |         res = new bytes32[](nSlots);
 550 |     | 
 551 |     |         for (uint256 i; i < nSlots;) {
 552 |     |             bytes32 slot = slots[i++];
 553 |     | 
 554 |     |             assembly ("memory-safe") {
 555 |     |                 mstore(add(res, mul(i, 32)), sload(slot))
 556 |     |             }
 557 |     |         }
 558 |     |     }
 559 |     | }
 560 |     |

  4 |     | /// @title IERC20

  6 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
  7 |     | /// @dev Empty because we only call library functions. It prevents calling transfer (transferFrom) instead of
  8 |     | /// safeTransfer (safeTransferFrom).
  9 |     | interface IERC20 {}

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/src/interfaces/IIrm.sol
  1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
  2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.5.0;
  3 |     | 
  4 |     | import {MarketParams, Market} from "./IMorpho.sol";
  5 |     | 
  6 |     | /// @title IIrm
  7 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
  8 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
  9 |     | /// @notice Interface that Interest Rate Models (IRMs) used by Morpho must implement.
 10 |     | interface IIrm {
 11 |     |     /// @notice Returns the borrow rate per second (scaled by WAD) of the market `marketParams`.
 12 |     |     /// @dev Assumes that `market` corresponds to `marketParams`.
 13 |     |     function borrowRate(MarketParams memory marketParams, Market memory market) external returns (uint256);
 14 |     | 
 15 |     |     /// @notice Returns the borrow rate per second (scaled by WAD) of the market `marketParams` without modifying any
 16 |     |     /// storage.
 17 |     |     /// @dev Assumes that `market` corresponds to `marketParams`.
 18 |     |     function borrowRateView(MarketParams memory marketParams, Market memory market) external view returns (uint256);
 19 |     | }
 20 |     | 

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/src/interfaces/IMorpho.sol
   1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
   2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.5.0;
   3 |     | 
   4 |     | type Id is bytes32;
   5 |     | 
   6 |     | struct MarketParams {
   7 |     |     address loanToken;
   8 |     |     address collateralToken;
   9 |     |     address oracle;
  10 |     |     address irm;
  11 |     |     uint256 lltv;
  12 |     | }
  13 |     | 
  14 |     | /// @dev Warning: For `feeRecipient`, `supplyShares` does not contain the accrued shares since the last interest
  15 |     | /// accrual.
  16 |     | struct Position {
  17 |     |     uint256 supplyShares;
  18 |     |     uint128 borrowShares;
  19 |     |     uint128 collateral;
  20 |     | }
  21 |     | 
  22 |     | /// @dev Warning: `totalSupplyAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
  23 |     | /// @dev Warning: `totalBorrowAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
  24 |     | /// @dev Warning: `totalSupplyShares` does not contain the additional shares accrued by `feeRecipient` since the last
  25 |     | /// interest accrual.
  26 |     | struct Market {
  27 |     |     uint128 totalSupplyAssets;
  28 |     |     uint128 totalSupplyShares;
  29 |     |     uint128 totalBorrowAssets;
  30 |     |     uint128 totalBorrowShares;
  31 |     |     uint128 lastUpdate;
  32 |     |     uint128 fee;
  33 |     | }
  34 |     | 
  35 |     | struct Authorization {
  36 |     |     address authorizer;
  37 |     |     address authorized;
  38 |     |     bool isAuthorized;
  39 |     |     uint256 nonce;
  40 |     |     uint256 deadline;
  41 |     | }
  42 |     | 
  43 |     | struct Signature {
  44 |     |     uint8 v;
  45 |     |     bytes32 r;
  46 |     |     bytes32 s;
  47 |     | }
  48 |     | 
  49 |     | /// @dev This interface is used for factorizing IMorphoStaticTyping and IMorpho.
  50 |     | /// @dev Consider using the IMorpho interface instead of this one.
  51 |     | interface IMorphoBase {
  52 |     |     /// @notice The EIP-712 domain separator.
  53 |     |     /// @dev Warning: Every EIP-712 signed message based on this domain separator can be reused on chains sharing the
  54 |     |     /// same chain id and on forks because the domain separator would be the same.
  55 |     |     function DOMAIN_SEPARATOR() external view returns (bytes32);
  56 |     | 
  57 |     |     /// @notice The owner of the contract.
  58 |     |     /// @dev It has the power to change the owner.
  59 |     |     /// @dev It has the power to set fees on markets and set the fee recipient.
  60 |     |     /// @dev It has the power to enable but not disable IRMs and LLTVs.
  61 |     |     function owner() external view returns (address);
  62 |     | 
  63 |     |     /// @notice The fee recipient of all markets.
  64 |     |     /// @dev The recipient receives the fees of a given market through a supply position on that market.
  65 |     |     function feeRecipient() external view returns (address);
  66 |     | 
  67 |     |     /// @notice Whether the `irm` is enabled.
  68 |     |     function isIrmEnabled(address irm) external view returns (bool);
  69 |     | 
  70 |     |     /// @notice Whether the `lltv` is enabled.
  71 |     |     function isLltvEnabled(uint256 lltv) external view returns (bool);
  72 |     | 
  73 |     |     /// @notice Whether `authorized` is authorized to modify `authorizer`'s position on all markets.
  74 |     |     /// @dev Anyone is authorized to modify their own positions, regardless of this variable.
  75 |     |     function isAuthorized(address authorizer, address authorized) external view returns (bool);
  76 |     | 
  77 |     |     /// @notice The `authorizer`'s current nonce. Used to prevent replay attacks with EIP-712 signatures.
  78 |     |     function nonce(address authorizer) external view returns (uint256);
  79 |     | 
  80 |     |     /// @notice Sets `newOwner` as `owner` of the contract.
  81 |     |     /// @dev Warning: No two-step transfer ownership.
  82 |     |     /// @dev Warning: The owner can be set to the zero address.
  83 |     |     function setOwner(address newOwner) external;
  84 |     | 
  85 |     |     /// @notice Enables `irm` as a possible IRM for market creation.
  86 |     |     /// @dev Warning: It is not possible to disable an IRM.
  87 |     |     function enableIrm(address irm) external;
  88 |     | 
  89 |     |     /// @notice Enables `lltv` as a possible LLTV for market creation.
  90 |     |     /// @dev Warning: It is not possible to disable a LLTV.
  91 |     |     function enableLltv(uint256 lltv) external;
  92 |     | 
  93 |     |     /// @notice Sets the `newFee` for the given market `marketParams`.
  94 |     |     /// @param newFee The new fee, scaled by WAD.
  95 |     |     /// @dev Warning: The recipient can be the zero address.
  96 |     |     function setFee(MarketParams memory marketParams, uint256 newFee) external;
  97 |     | 
  98 |     |     /// @notice Sets `newFeeRecipient` as `feeRecipient` of the fee.
  99 |     |     /// @dev Warning: If the fee recipient is set to the zero address, fees will accrue there and will be lost.
 100 |     |     /// @dev Modifying the fee recipient will allow the new recipient to claim any pending fees not yet accrued. To
 101 |     |     /// ensure that the current recipient receives all due fees, accrue interest manually prior to making any changes.
 102 |     |     function setFeeRecipient(address newFeeRecipient) external;
 103 |     | 
 104 |     |     /// @notice Creates the market `marketParams`.
 105 |     |     /// @dev Here is the list of assumptions on the market's dependencies (tokens, IRM and oracle) that guarantees
 106 |     |     /// Morpho behaves as expected:
 107 |     |     /// - The token should be ERC-20 compliant, except that it can omit return values on `transfer` and `transferFrom`.
 108 |     |     /// - The token balance of Morpho should only decrease on `transfer` and `transferFrom`. In particular, tokens with
 109 |     |     /// burn functions are not supported.
 110 |     |     /// - The token should not re-enter Morpho on `transfer` nor `transferFrom`.
 111 |     |     /// - The token balance of the sender (resp. receiver) should decrease (resp. increase) by exactly the given amount
 112 |     |     /// on `transfer` and `transferFrom`. In particular, tokens with fees on transfer are not supported.
 113 |     |     /// - The IRM should not re-enter Morpho.
 114 |     |     /// - The oracle should return a price with the correct scaling.
 115 |     |     /// @dev Here is a list of assumptions on the market's dependencies which, if broken, could break Morpho's liveness
 116 |     |     /// properties (funds could get stuck):
 117 |     |     /// - The token should not revert on `transfer` and `transferFrom` if balances and approvals are right.
 118 |     |     /// - The amount of assets supplied and borrowed should not go above ~1e35 (otherwise the computation of
 119 |     |     /// `toSharesUp` and `toSharesDown` can overflow).
 120 |     |     /// - The IRM should not revert on `borrowRate`.
 121 |     |     /// - The IRM should not return a very high borrow rate (otherwise the computation of `interest` in
 122 |     |     /// `_accrueInterest` can overflow).
 123 |     |     /// - The oracle should not revert `price`.
 124 |     |     /// - The oracle should not return a very high price (otherwise the computation of `maxBorrow` in `_isHealthy` or of
 125 |     |     /// `assetsRepaid` in `liquidate` can overflow).
 126 |     |     /// @dev The borrow share price of a market with less than 1e4 assets borrowed can be decreased by manipulations, to
 127 |     |     /// the point where `totalBorrowShares` is very large and borrowing overflows.
 128 |     |     function createMarket(MarketParams memory marketParams) external;
 129 |     | 
 130 |     |     /// @notice Supplies `assets` or `shares` on behalf of `onBehalf`, optionally calling back the caller's
 131 |     |     /// `onMorphoSupply` function with the given `data`.
 132 |     |     /// @dev Either `assets` or `shares` should be zero. Most use cases should rely on `assets` as an input so the
 133 |     |     /// caller is guaranteed to have `assets` tokens pulled from their balance, but the possibility to mint a specific
 134 |     |     /// amount of shares is given for full compatibility and precision.
 135 |     |     /// @dev Supplying a large amount can revert for overflow.
 136 |     |     /// @dev Supplying an amount of shares may lead to supply more or fewer assets than expected due to slippage.
 137 |     |     /// Consider using the `assets` parameter to avoid this.
 138 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to supply assets to.
 139 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets to supply.
 140 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares to mint.
 141 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address that will own the increased supply position.
 142 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data to pass to the `onMorphoSupply` callback. Pass empty data if not needed.
 143 |     |     /// @return assetsSupplied The amount of assets supplied.
 144 |     |     /// @return sharesSupplied The amount of shares minted.
 145 |     |     function supply(
 146 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 147 |     |         uint256 assets,
 148 |     |         uint256 shares,
 149 |     |         address onBehalf,
 150 |     |         bytes memory data
 151 |     |     ) external returns (uint256 assetsSupplied, uint256 sharesSupplied);
 152 |     | 
 153 |     |     /// @notice Withdraws `assets` or `shares` on behalf of `onBehalf` and sends the assets to `receiver`.
 154 |     |     /// @dev Either `assets` or `shares` should be zero. To withdraw max, pass the `shares`'s balance of `onBehalf`.
 155 |     |     /// @dev `msg.sender` must be authorized to manage `onBehalf`'s positions.
 156 |     |     /// @dev Withdrawing an amount corresponding to more shares than supplied will revert for underflow.
 157 |     |     /// @dev It is advised to use the `shares` input when withdrawing the full position to avoid reverts due to
 158 |     |     /// conversion roundings between shares and assets.
 159 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to withdraw assets from.
 160 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets to withdraw.
 161 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares to burn.
 162 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address of the owner of the supply position.
 163 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that will receive the withdrawn assets.
 164 |     |     /// @return assetsWithdrawn The amount of assets withdrawn.
 165 |     |     /// @return sharesWithdrawn The amount of shares burned.
 166 |     |     function withdraw(
 167 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 168 |     |         uint256 assets,
 169 |     |         uint256 shares,
 170 |     |         address onBehalf,
 171 |     |         address receiver
 172 |     |     ) external returns (uint256 assetsWithdrawn, uint256 sharesWithdrawn);
 173 |     | 
 174 |     |     /// @notice Borrows `assets` or `shares` on behalf of `onBehalf` and sends the assets to `receiver`.
 175 |     |     /// @dev Either `assets` or `shares` should be zero. Most use cases should rely on `assets` as an input so the
 176 |     |     /// caller is guaranteed to borrow `assets` of tokens, but the possibility to mint a specific amount of shares is
 177 |     |     /// given for full compatibility and precision.
 178 |     |     /// @dev `msg.sender` must be authorized to manage `onBehalf`'s positions.
 179 |     |     /// @dev Borrowing a large amount can revert for overflow.
 180 |     |     /// @dev Borrowing an amount of shares may lead to borrow fewer assets than expected due to slippage.
 181 |     |     /// Consider using the `assets` parameter to avoid this.
 182 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to borrow assets from.
 183 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets to borrow.
 184 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares to mint.
 185 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address that will own the increased borrow position.
 186 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that will receive the borrowed assets.
 187 |     |     /// @return assetsBorrowed The amount of assets borrowed.
 188 |     |     /// @return sharesBorrowed The amount of shares minted.
 189 |     |     function borrow(
 190 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 191 |     |         uint256 assets,
 192 |     |         uint256 shares,
 193 |     |         address onBehalf,
 194 |     |         address receiver
 195 |     |     ) external returns (uint256 assetsBorrowed, uint256 sharesBorrowed);
 196 |     | 
 197 |     |     /// @notice Repays `assets` or `shares` on behalf of `onBehalf`, optionally calling back the caller's
 198 |     |     /// `onMorphoRepay` function with the given `data`.
 199 |     |     /// @dev Either `assets` or `shares` should be zero. To repay max, pass the `shares`'s balance of `onBehalf`.
 200 |     |     /// @dev Repaying an amount corresponding to more shares than borrowed will revert for underflow.
 201 |     |     /// @dev It is advised to use the `shares` input when repaying the full position to avoid reverts due to conversion
 202 |     |     /// roundings between shares and assets.
 203 |     |     /// @dev An attacker can front-run a repay with a small repay making the transaction revert for underflow.
 204 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to repay assets to.
 205 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets to repay.
 206 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares to burn.
 207 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address of the owner of the debt position.
 208 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data to pass to the `onMorphoRepay` callback. Pass empty data if not needed.
 209 |     |     /// @return assetsRepaid The amount of assets repaid.
 210 |     |     /// @return sharesRepaid The amount of shares burned.
 211 |     |     function repay(
 212 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 213 |     |         uint256 assets,
 214 |     |         uint256 shares,
 215 |     |         address onBehalf,
 216 |     |         bytes memory data
 217 |     |     ) external returns (uint256 assetsRepaid, uint256 sharesRepaid);
 218 |     | 
 219 |     |     /// @notice Supplies `assets` of collateral on behalf of `onBehalf`, optionally calling back the caller's
 220 |     |     /// `onMorphoSupplyCollateral` function with the given `data`.
 221 |     |     /// @dev Interest are not accrued since it's not required and it saves gas.
 222 |     |     /// @dev Supplying a large amount can revert for overflow.
 223 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to supply collateral to.
 224 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of collateral to supply.
 225 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address that will own the increased collateral position.
 226 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data to pass to the `onMorphoSupplyCollateral` callback. Pass empty data if not needed.
 227 |     |     function supplyCollateral(MarketParams memory marketParams, uint256 assets, address onBehalf, bytes memory data)
 228 |     |         external;
 229 |     | 
 230 |     |     /// @notice Withdraws `assets` of collateral on behalf of `onBehalf` and sends the assets to `receiver`.
 231 |     |     /// @dev `msg.sender` must be authorized to manage `onBehalf`'s positions.
 232 |     |     /// @dev Withdrawing an amount corresponding to more collateral than supplied will revert for underflow.
 233 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market to withdraw collateral from.
 234 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of collateral to withdraw.
 235 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The address of the owner of the collateral position.
 236 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that will receive the collateral assets.
 237 |     |     function withdrawCollateral(MarketParams memory marketParams, uint256 assets, address onBehalf, address receiver)
 238 |     |         external;
 239 |     | 
 240 |     |     /// @notice Liquidates the given `repaidShares` of debt asset or seize the given `seizedAssets` of collateral on the
 241 |     |     /// given market `marketParams` of the given `borrower`'s position, optionally calling back the caller's
 242 |     |     /// `onMorphoLiquidate` function with the given `data`.
 243 |     |     /// @dev Either `seizedAssets` or `repaidShares` should be zero.
 244 |     |     /// @dev Seizing more than the collateral balance will underflow and revert without any error message.
 245 |     |     /// @dev Repaying more than the borrow balance will underflow and revert without any error message.
 246 |     |     /// @dev An attacker can front-run a liquidation with a small repay making the transaction revert for underflow.
 247 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market of the position.
 248 |     |     /// @param borrower The owner of the position.
 249 |     |     /// @param seizedAssets The amount of collateral to seize.
 250 |     |     /// @param repaidShares The amount of shares to repay.
 251 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data to pass to the `onMorphoLiquidate` callback. Pass empty data if not needed.
 252 |     |     /// @return The amount of assets seized.
 253 |     |     /// @return The amount of assets repaid.
 254 |     |     function liquidate(
 255 |     |         MarketParams memory marketParams,
 256 |     |         address borrower,
 257 |     |         uint256 seizedAssets,
 258 |     |         uint256 repaidShares,
 259 |     |         bytes memory data
 260 |     |     ) external returns (uint256, uint256);
 261 |     | 
 262 |     |     /// @notice Executes a flash loan.
 263 |     |     /// @dev Flash loans have access to the whole balance of the contract (the liquidity and deposited collateral of all
 264 |     |     /// markets combined, plus donations).
 265 |     |     /// @dev Warning: Not ERC-3156 compliant but compatibility is easily reached:
 266 |     |     /// - `flashFee` is zero.
 267 |     |     /// - `maxFlashLoan` is the token's balance of this contract.
 268 |     |     /// - The receiver of `assets` is the caller.
 269 |     |     /// @param token The token to flash loan.
 270 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets to flash loan.
 271 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data to pass to the `onMorphoFlashLoan` callback.
 272 |     |     function flashLoan(address token, uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external;
 273 |     | 
 274 |     |     /// @notice Sets the authorization for `authorized` to manage `msg.sender`'s positions.
 275 |     |     /// @param authorized The authorized address.
 276 |     |     /// @param newIsAuthorized The new authorization status.
 277 |     |     function setAuthorization(address authorized, bool newIsAuthorized) external;
 278 |     | 
 279 |     |     /// @notice Sets the authorization for `authorization.authorized` to manage `authorization.authorizer`'s positions.
 280 |     |     /// @dev Warning: Reverts if the signature has already been submitted.
 281 |     |     /// @dev The signature is malleable, but it has no impact on the security here.
 282 |     |     /// @dev The nonce is passed as argument to be able to revert with a different error message.
 283 |     |     /// @param authorization The `Authorization` struct.
 284 |     |     /// @param signature The signature.
 285 |     |     function setAuthorizationWithSig(Authorization calldata authorization, Signature calldata signature) external;
 286 |     | 
 287 |     |     /// @notice Accrues interest for the given market `marketParams`.
 288 |     |     function accrueInterest(MarketParams memory marketParams) external;
 289 |     | 
 290 |     |     /// @notice Returns the data stored on the different `slots`.
 291 |     |     function extSloads(bytes32[] memory slots) external view returns (bytes32[] memory);
 292 |     | }
 293 |     | 
 294 |     | /// @dev This interface is inherited by Morpho so that function signatures are checked by the compiler.
 295 |     | /// @dev Consider using the IMorpho interface instead of this one.
 296 |     | interface IMorphoStaticTyping is IMorphoBase {
 297 |     |     /// @notice The state of the position of `user` on the market corresponding to `id`.
 298 |     |     /// @dev Warning: For `feeRecipient`, `supplyShares` does not contain the accrued shares since the last interest
 299 |     |     /// accrual.
 300 |     |     function position(Id id, address user)
 301 |     |         external
 302 |     |         view
 303 |     |         returns (uint256 supplyShares, uint128 borrowShares, uint128 collateral);
 304 |     | 
 305 |     |     /// @notice The state of the market corresponding to `id`.
 306 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `totalSupplyAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
 307 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `totalBorrowAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
 308 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `totalSupplyShares` does not contain the accrued shares by `feeRecipient` since the last interest
 309 |     |     /// accrual.
 310 |     |     function market(Id id)
 311 |     |         external
 312 |     |         view
 313 |     |         returns (
 314 |     |             uint128 totalSupplyAssets,
 315 |     |             uint128 totalSupplyShares,
 316 |     |             uint128 totalBorrowAssets,
 317 |     |             uint128 totalBorrowShares,
 318 |     |             uint128 lastUpdate,
 319 |     |             uint128 fee
 320 |     |         );
 321 |     | 
 322 |     |     /// @notice The market params corresponding to `id`.
 323 |     |     /// @dev This mapping is not used in Morpho. It is there to enable reducing the cost associated to calldata on layer
 324 |     |     /// 2s by creating a wrapper contract with functions that take `id` as input instead of `marketParams`.
 325 |     |     function idToMarketParams(Id id)
 326 |     |         external
 327 |     |         view
 328 |     |         returns (address loanToken, address collateralToken, address oracle, address irm, uint256 lltv);
 329 |     | }
 330 |     | 
 331 |     | /// @title IMorpho
 332 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
 333 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
 334 |     | /// @dev Use this interface for Morpho to have access to all the functions with the appropriate function signatures.
 335 |     | interface IMorpho is IMorphoBase {
 336 |     |     /// @notice The state of the position of `user` on the market corresponding to `id`.
 337 |     |     /// @dev Warning: For `feeRecipient`, `p.supplyShares` does not contain the accrued shares since the last interest
 338 |     |     /// accrual.
 339 |     |     function position(Id id, address user) external view returns (Position memory p);
 340 |     | 
 341 |     |     /// @notice The state of the market corresponding to `id`.
 342 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `m.totalSupplyAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
 343 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `m.totalBorrowAssets` does not contain the accrued interest since the last interest accrual.
 344 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `m.totalSupplyShares` does not contain the accrued shares by `feeRecipient` since the last
 345 |     |     /// interest accrual.
 346 |     |     function market(Id id) external view returns (Market memory m);
 347 |     | 
 348 |     |     /// @notice The market params corresponding to `id`.
 349 |     |     /// @dev This mapping is not used in Morpho. It is there to enable reducing the cost associated to calldata on layer
 350 |     |     /// 2s by creating a wrapper contract with functions that take `id` as input instead of `marketParams`.
 351 |     |     function idToMarketParams(Id id) external view returns (MarketParams memory);
 352 |     | }
 353 |     | 

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/src/interfaces/IMorphoCallbacks.sol
  1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
  2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.5.0;
  3 |     | 
  4 |     | /// @title IMorphoLiquidateCallback
  5 |     | /// @notice Interface that liquidators willing to use `liquidate`'s callback must implement.
  6 |     | interface IMorphoLiquidateCallback {
  7 |     |     /// @notice Callback called when a liquidation occurs.
  8 |     |     /// @dev The callback is called only if data is not empty.
  9 |     |     /// @param repaidAssets The amount of repaid assets.
 10 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data passed to the `liquidate` function.
 11 |     |     function onMorphoLiquidate(uint256 repaidAssets, bytes calldata data) external;
 12 |     | }
 13 |     | 
 14 |     | /// @title IMorphoRepayCallback
 15 |     | /// @notice Interface that users willing to use `repay`'s callback must implement.
 16 |     | interface IMorphoRepayCallback {
 17 |     |     /// @notice Callback called when a repayment occurs.
 18 |     |     /// @dev The callback is called only if data is not empty.
 19 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of repaid assets.
 20 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data passed to the `repay` function.
 21 |     |     function onMorphoRepay(uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external;
 22 |     | }
 23 |     | 
 24 |     | /// @title IMorphoSupplyCallback
 25 |     | /// @notice Interface that users willing to use `supply`'s callback must implement.
 26 |     | interface IMorphoSupplyCallback {
 27 |     |     /// @notice Callback called when a supply occurs.
 28 |     |     /// @dev The callback is called only if data is not empty.
 29 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of supplied assets.
 30 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data passed to the `supply` function.
 31 |     |     function onMorphoSupply(uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external;
 32 |     | }
 33 |     | 
 34 |     | /// @title IMorphoSupplyCollateralCallback
 35 |     | /// @notice Interface that users willing to use `supplyCollateral`'s callback must implement.
 36 |     | interface IMorphoSupplyCollateralCallback {
 37 |     |     /// @notice Callback called when a supply of collateral occurs.
 38 |     |     /// @dev The callback is called only if data is not empty.
 39 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of supplied collateral.
 40 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data passed to the `supplyCollateral` function.
 41 |     |     function onMorphoSupplyCollateral(uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external;
 42 |     | }
 43 |     | 
 44 |     | /// @title IMorphoFlashLoanCallback
 45 |     | /// @notice Interface that users willing to use `flashLoan`'s callback must implement.
 46 |     | interface IMorphoFlashLoanCallback {
 47 |     |     /// @notice Callback called when a flash loan occurs.
 48 |     |     /// @dev The callback is called only if data is not empty.
 49 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets that was flash loaned.
 50 |     |     /// @param data Arbitrary data passed to the `flashLoan` function.
 51 |     |     function onMorphoFlashLoan(uint256 assets, bytes calldata data) external;
 52 |     | }
 53 |     | 

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/src/interfaces/IOracle.sol
  1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
  2 |     | pragma solidity >=0.5.0;
  3 |     | 
  4 |     | /// @title IOracle
  5 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
  6 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
  7 |     | /// @notice Interface that oracles used by Morpho must implement.
  8 |     | /// @dev It is the user's responsibility to select markets with safe oracles.
  9 |     | interface IOracle {
 10 |     |     /// @notice Returns the price of 1 asset of collateral token quoted in 1 asset of loan token, scaled by 1e36.
 11 |     |     /// @dev It corresponds to the price of 10**(collateral token decimals) assets of collateral token quoted in
 12 |     |     /// 10**(loan token decimals) assets of loan token with `36 + loan token decimals - collateral token decimals`
 13 |     |     /// decimals of precision.
 14 |     |     function price() external view returns (uint256);
 15 |     | }
 16 |     |

  4 |     | /// @dev The maximum fee a market can have (25%).
  5 | *   | uint256 constant MAX_FEE = 0.25e18;
  6 |     |

  8 | *   | uint256 constant ORACLE_PRICE_SCALE = 1e36;
  9 |     | 
 10 |     | /// @dev Liquidation cursor.
 11 | *   | uint256 constant LIQUIDATION_CURSOR = 0.3e18;
 12 |     | 
 13 |     | /// @dev Max liquidation incentive factor.
 14 | *   | uint256 constant MAX_LIQUIDATION_INCENTIVE_FACTOR = 1.15e18;
 15 |     | 
 16 |     | /// @dev The EIP-712 typeHash for EIP712Domain.
 17 | *   | bytes32 constant DOMAIN_TYPEHASH = keccak256("EIP712Domain(uint256 chainId,address verifyingContract)");
 18 |     | 
 19 |     | /// @dev The EIP-712 typeHash for Authorization.
 20 |     | bytes32 constant AUTHORIZATION_TYPEHASH =
 21 |     |     keccak256("Authorization(address authorizer,address authorized,bool isAuthorized,uint256 nonce,uint256 deadline)");

  1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
  2 |     | pragma solidity ^0.8.0;
  3 |     | 
  4 |     | /// @title ErrorsLib
  5 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
  6 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
  7 |     | /// @notice Library exposing error messages.
  8 |     | library ErrorsLib {
  9 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the caller is not the owner.
 10 | *   |     string internal constant NOT_OWNER = "not owner";
 11 |     | 
 12 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the LLTV to enable exceeds the maximum LLTV.
 13 |     |     string internal constant MAX_LLTV_EXCEEDED = "max LLTV exceeded";
 14 |     | 
 15 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the fee to set exceeds the maximum fee.
 16 | *   |     string internal constant MAX_FEE_EXCEEDED = "max fee exceeded";
 17 |     | 
 18 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the value is already set.
 19 | *   |     string internal constant ALREADY_SET = "already set";
 20 |     | 
 21 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the IRM is not enabled at market creation.
 22 | *   |     string internal constant IRM_NOT_ENABLED = "IRM not enabled";
 23 |     | 
 24 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the LLTV is not enabled at market creation.
 25 | *   |     string internal constant LLTV_NOT_ENABLED = "LLTV not enabled";
 26 |     | 
 27 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the market is already created.
 28 | *   |     string internal constant MARKET_ALREADY_CREATED = "market already created";
 29 |     | 
 30 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a token to transfer doesn't have code.
 31 | *   |     string internal constant NO_CODE = "no code";
 32 |     | 
 33 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the market is not created.
 34 |     |     string internal constant MARKET_NOT_CREATED = "market not created";
 35 |     | 
 36 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when not exactly one of the input amount is zero.
 37 | *   |     string internal constant INCONSISTENT_INPUT = "inconsistent input";
 38 |     | 
 39 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when zero assets is passed as input.
 40 |     |     string internal constant ZERO_ASSETS = "zero assets";
 41 |     | 
 42 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a zero address is passed as input.
 43 | *   |     string internal constant ZERO_ADDRESS = "zero address";
 44 |     | 
 45 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the caller is not authorized to conduct an action.
 46 | *   |     string internal constant UNAUTHORIZED = "unauthorized";
 47 |     | 
 48 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the collateral is insufficient to `borrow` or `withdrawCollateral`.
 49 |     |     string internal constant INSUFFICIENT_COLLATERAL = "insufficient collateral";
 50 |     | 
 51 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the liquidity is insufficient to `withdraw` or `borrow`.
 52 | *   |     string internal constant INSUFFICIENT_LIQUIDITY = "insufficient liquidity";
 53 |     | 
 54 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the position to liquidate is healthy.
 55 |     |     string internal constant HEALTHY_POSITION = "position is healthy";
 56 |     | 
 57 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the authorization signature is invalid.
 58 |     |     string internal constant INVALID_SIGNATURE = "invalid signature";
 59 |     | 
 60 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the authorization signature is expired.
 61 |     |     string internal constant SIGNATURE_EXPIRED = "signature expired";
 62 |     | 
 63 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the nonce is invalid.
 64 |     |     string internal constant INVALID_NONCE = "invalid nonce";
 65 |     | 
 66 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a token transfer reverted.
 67 | *   |     string internal constant TRANSFER_REVERTED = "transfer reverted";
 68 |     | 
 69 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a token transfer returned false.
 70 |     |     string internal constant TRANSFER_RETURNED_FALSE = "transfer returned false";
 71 |     | 
 72 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a token transferFrom reverted.
 73 | *   |     string internal constant TRANSFER_FROM_REVERTED = "transferFrom reverted";
 74 |     | 
 75 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when a token transferFrom returned false
 76 |     |     string internal constant TRANSFER_FROM_RETURNED_FALSE = "transferFrom returned false";
 77 |     | 
 78 |     |     /// @notice Thrown when the maximum uint128 is exceeded.
 79 |     |     string internal constant MAX_UINT128_EXCEEDED = "max uint128 exceeded";
 80 |     | }

/home/giorgio/Documents/FuzzCademy/BootCamp/morpho-blue/src/libraries/EventsLib.sol
   1 |     | // SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later
   2 |     | pragma solidity ^0.8.0;
   3 |     | 
   4 |     | import {Id, MarketParams} from "../interfaces/IMorpho.sol";
   5 |     | 
   6 |     | /// @title EventsLib
   7 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
   8 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
   9 |     | /// @notice Library exposing events.
  10 |     | library EventsLib {
  11 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when setting a new owner.
  12 |     |     /// @param newOwner The new owner of the contract.
  13 |     |     event SetOwner(address indexed newOwner);
  14 |     | 
  15 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when setting a new fee.
  16 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  17 |     |     /// @param newFee The new fee.
  18 |     |     event SetFee(Id indexed id, uint256 newFee);
  19 |     | 
  20 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when setting a new fee recipient.
  21 |     |     /// @param newFeeRecipient The new fee recipient.
  22 |     |     event SetFeeRecipient(address indexed newFeeRecipient);
  23 |     | 
  24 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when enabling an IRM.
  25 |     |     /// @param irm The IRM that was enabled.
  26 |     |     event EnableIrm(address indexed irm);
  27 |     | 
  28 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when enabling an LLTV.
  29 |     |     /// @param lltv The LLTV that was enabled.
  30 |     |     event EnableLltv(uint256 lltv);
  31 |     | 
  32 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when creating a market.
  33 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  34 |     |     /// @param marketParams The market that was created.
  35 |     |     event CreateMarket(Id indexed id, MarketParams marketParams);
  36 |     | 
  37 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on supply of assets.
  38 |     |     /// @dev Warning: `feeRecipient` receives some shares during interest accrual without any supply event emitted.
  39 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  40 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  41 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  42 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets supplied.
  43 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares minted.
  44 |     |     event Supply(Id indexed id, address indexed caller, address indexed onBehalf, uint256 assets, uint256 shares);
  45 |     | 
  46 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on withdrawal of assets.
  47 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  48 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  49 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  50 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that received the withdrawn assets.
  51 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets withdrawn.
  52 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares burned.
  53 |     |     event Withdraw(
  54 |     |         Id indexed id,
  55 |     |         address caller,
  56 |     |         address indexed onBehalf,
  57 |     |         address indexed receiver,
  58 |     |         uint256 assets,
  59 |     |         uint256 shares
  60 |     |     );
  61 |     | 
  62 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on borrow of assets.
  63 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  64 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  65 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  66 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that received the borrowed assets.
  67 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets borrowed.
  68 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares minted.
  69 |     |     event Borrow(
  70 |     |         Id indexed id,
  71 |     |         address caller,
  72 |     |         address indexed onBehalf,
  73 |     |         address indexed receiver,
  74 |     |         uint256 assets,
  75 |     |         uint256 shares
  76 |     |     );
  77 |     | 
  78 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on repayment of assets.
  79 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  80 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  81 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  82 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of assets repaid. May be 1 over the corresponding market's `totalBorrowAssets`.
  83 |     |     /// @param shares The amount of shares burned.
  84 |     |     event Repay(Id indexed id, address indexed caller, address indexed onBehalf, uint256 assets, uint256 shares);
  85 |     | 
  86 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on supply of collateral.
  87 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  88 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  89 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  90 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of collateral supplied.
  91 |     |     event SupplyCollateral(Id indexed id, address indexed caller, address indexed onBehalf, uint256 assets);
  92 |     | 
  93 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on withdrawal of collateral.
  94 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
  95 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
  96 |     |     /// @param onBehalf The owner of the modified position.
  97 |     |     /// @param receiver The address that received the withdrawn collateral.
  98 |     |     /// @param assets The amount of collateral withdrawn.
  99 |     |     event WithdrawCollateral(
 100 |     |         Id indexed id, address caller, address indexed onBehalf, address indexed receiver, uint256 assets
 101 |     |     );
 102 |     | 
 103 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on liquidation of a position.
 104 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
 105 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
 106 |     |     /// @param borrower The borrower of the position.
 107 |     |     /// @param repaidAssets The amount of assets repaid. May be 1 over the corresponding market's `totalBorrowAssets`.
 108 |     |     /// @param repaidShares The amount of shares burned.
 109 |     |     /// @param seizedAssets The amount of collateral seized.
 110 |     |     /// @param badDebtAssets The amount of assets of bad debt realized.
 111 |     |     /// @param badDebtShares The amount of borrow shares of bad debt realized.
 112 |     |     event Liquidate(
 113 |     |         Id indexed id,
 114 |     |         address indexed caller,
 115 |     |         address indexed borrower,
 116 |     |         uint256 repaidAssets,
 117 |     |         uint256 repaidShares,
 118 |     |         uint256 seizedAssets,
 119 |     |         uint256 badDebtAssets,
 120 |     |         uint256 badDebtShares
 121 |     |     );
 122 |     | 
 123 |     |     /// @notice Emitted on flash loan.
 124 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
 125 |     |     /// @param token The token that was flash loaned.
 126 |     |     /// @param assets The amount that was flash loaned.
 127 |     |     event FlashLoan(address indexed caller, address indexed token, uint256 assets);
 128 |     | 
 129 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when setting an authorization.
 130 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
 131 |     |     /// @param authorizer The authorizer address.
 132 |     |     /// @param authorized The authorized address.
 133 |     |     /// @param newIsAuthorized The new authorization status.
 134 |     |     event SetAuthorization(
 135 |     |         address indexed caller, address indexed authorizer, address indexed authorized, bool newIsAuthorized
 136 |     |     );
 137 |     | 
 138 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when setting an authorization with a signature.
 139 |     |     /// @param caller The caller.
 140 |     |     /// @param authorizer The authorizer address.
 141 |     |     /// @param usedNonce The nonce that was used.
 142 |     |     event IncrementNonce(address indexed caller, address indexed authorizer, uint256 usedNonce);
 143 |     | 
 144 |     |     /// @notice Emitted when accruing interest.
 145 |     |     /// @param id The market id.
 146 |     |     /// @param prevBorrowRate The previous borrow rate.
 147 |     |     /// @param interest The amount of interest accrued.
 148 |     |     /// @param feeShares The amount of shares minted as fee.
 149 |     |     event AccrueInterest(Id indexed id, uint256 prevBorrowRate, uint256 interest, uint256 feeShares);
 150 |     | }
 151 |     |

  2 |     | pragma solidity ^0.8.0;
  3 |     | 
  4 |     | import {Id, MarketParams} from "../interfaces/IMorpho.sol";
  5 |     | 
  6 |     | /// @title MarketParamsLib
  7 |     | /// @author Morpho Labs
  8 |     | /// @custom:contact security@morpho.org
  9 |     | /// @notice Library to convert a market to its id.
 10 |     | library MarketParamsLib {
 11 |     |     /// @notice The length of the data used to compute the id of a market.
 12 |     |     /// @dev The length is 5 * 32 because `MarketParams` has 5 variables of 32 bytes each.
 13 |     |     uint256 internal constant MARKET_PARAMS_BYTES_LENGTH = 5 * 32;
 14 |     | 
 15 |     |     /// @notice Returns the id of the market `marketParams`.
 16 |     |     function id(MarketParams memory marketParams) internal pure returns (Id marketParamsId) {
 17 | *   |         assembly ("memory-safe") {
 18 |     |             marketParamsId := keccak256(marketParams, MARKET_PARAMS_BYTES_LENGTH)
 19 |     |         }
 20 |     |     }
 21 |     | }
